statement.p: Guadalupe is conducting market research on the cost of a cruise vacation. Guadalupe has determined that the average cost of a cruise vacation is 4050, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 509.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 3440 on a cruise vacation.
b. The cost of the middle 40 of cruise vacations falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 17 of cruise vacations cost at least how much? (round to the nearest dollar)
